boardgame.name: Welcome to the Valley (D/MCC)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Valley Out of Time is a series of ‘zine-sized adventures from SGP. This valley can be placed in any ongoing campaign, and is set in the “Neanderthal Period” of development. Huge monsters – both dinosaurs and otherwise – and devolved humanoids plague the area, and only the hardiest of adventurers will prevail! This series of adventures borrows heavily from classic dinosaur art, books, and movies; if you’ve ever seen a classic Frank Frazetta or Roy Krenkel painting, or read or watched The Land that Time Forgot, The Lost World, Journey to the Center of the Earth, One Million Years B.C., The Flintstones, any stop-motion film from Ray Harryhausen, etc., you’re going to feel right at home.

Welcome to the Valley is a short introduction to the region, some of its people, and a few of its adversaries!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

Exploring the Valley takes a deeper dive into the region, describing many of its occupants, offering several pre-made encounters, and providing tools to expand and mold the area into your own sweet dinopolis!

boardgame.name: Water
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Create Water Monster Lairs in Minutes!
Enjoy quick, easy templates to spice up encounters, travel, and especially boss fights with aquatic creatures, fey, hags, merfolk, and water elementals, as well as for staging battles in coastal areas, flood zones, fog, lakes, rivers, and oceans.

In this extreme template pack, you get environment rules as well as new monsters and treasure ideas for:

Fog of War (magical terrain)
Beach (Rocks or Sand) (nonmagical terrain)
Flood (nonmagical terrain)
Rain (Light or Heavy) (nonmagical weather)
Rapids (nonmagical terrain)
River Crossing or Ferry (nonmagical terrain)
Rough Sea Voyage (nonmagical weather)
Sand Dunes (Coastal) (nonmagical terrain)
Waterfall (nonmagical terrain)

boardgame.name: Realm of Thraul: Stones
boardgame.description: 2-player game of strategy. Stones is a grid style board game with different colored squares defining a different type of movement. The goal of the game is to create a continuous stream of your color stones without getting stuck while accumulating more points than you opponent. Points are earned by landing on pink diamond squares; however, the pink diamond squares are also where your opponent can steal your stone and collect extra points for themselves.

boardgame.name: Burn the Festival
boardgame.description:
In Burn The Festival you will have to be the rabbit that most mess up a music festival without dying in the attempt. Or rather, without getting killed trying!

It is a card game, where you will have to get the cards with the highest scores and prevent your rivals from getting the cards with the highest scores.

Shuffle the cards and start by drawing 6 cards. The player in his turn must draw a card from the center deck and decide which card from his hand he is going to play. The opponents may, in turn, use the cards in their hands to prevent the card played from coming into play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pierwsze
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pierwsze to suplement do gry fabularnej Strzygi pozwalający na przeniesienie rozgrywki w brutalne realia epoki lodowcowej, żeby zagrać strzygami czerpiącymi moc ze skór pradawnych bestii, w których zostały pochowane.

Niniejszy suplement doskonale łączy się z dodatkiem Barwy Wojny, dając uczestnikom szeroki wybór opcji w plemiennych klimatach.

boardgame.name: The Sherlock Files: Vol VI – Devilish Details
boardgame.description:
Sherlock Files, vol. 6: Devilish Details includes three new confounding cases to solve.

Diagnose the cause of why a shopkeeper’s innocuous stumble led to an unlikely death.
Discover if there’s a cure for a medieval mayor’s illness, or if he has been possessed by a demon!
Track down the truth behind a Renaissance woman’s death, and why her fingers are mysteriously dyed blue...
For each case, you will follow the clues, piece together the evidence, and then identify who did it, how, and why.
This is a completely standalone game and does not require any other Sherlock Files games to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fairmarket
boardgame.description:
Fairmarket is a gambling game for 2-6 players. The game uses the “Knotts Deck,” a unique deck from DeVere’s South Coast, in the Dew Point universe. The deck has three suits (flags, cups, and bells), and an unusual distribution of numbers: Ace through 9, then 10 through 60, and three face cards.

Players ante five coins to begin, and divide these coins into five pots in the center of the table.

Players then receive five cards and stack them in order on the table.

Round by round, players cards compete against each other, and cards in the center, to win the money in those pots.

It’s a simple and fast card game with lots of variations and plenty of action!

boardgame.name: Uncaged: Goddesses
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Uncaged: Goddesses, an epic collection of Tier 4 adventures spanning the multiverse. Each adventure centers around an evil- or neutral-aligned goddess from the various pantheons in Dungeons & Dragons. Many of these goddesses have been featured in past D&D publications, but rarely do these stories opt to explore the goddesses’ own histories, conflicts, and goals. As with the first four volumes of the Uncaged Anthology, we invite you to explore some of what makes these often ignored, flattened, or maligned beings tick. After all, every villain has her reasons.

boardgame.name: Schnauferl und Eisenbahn
boardgame.description:
The players form two parties. Everyone puts a bet to be determined in advance into the till. Two players take over the positions of the signalmen and handle the closing and opening of the railway barriers. One party starts at C, the other at D. The players take turns rolling the die and moving. After the first throw has fallen, the work of the signalmen begins. If a straight throw (2, 4, 6) has been thrown, the strip representing the railway is positioned on II, if odd (1, 3 , 5) is thrown, it is on I. This is to be done after each throw, and this will alternately block the blue stripe representing the country road. If the railway crossing is closed, the players have to stop till it opens again.

E-F presents a bridge on which 2 cars cannot drive side by side. If a player comes to the bridge and this is occupied by an oncoming car, he has to wait at E or F until the bridge is free. Also, no player can overtake a car moving in the same direction, but must occupy the next space behind it.

If two oncoming cars come to a stop on the same space on the road, this means a collision. The two players then have to roll the dice together. The lower throw is eliminated from the game, the other moves back 10 spaces.

Whoever reaches the opposite end of the lane first gets half the contents of the till and his party a point, and for each additional car that arrives earlier than the first car of the other party, another point. The first winner of the opposing party receives a quarter of the contents of the till. The last quarter remains in the till. The game is repeated until one party has 30 points. This party distributes the remainder in the till evenly among its members.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Cold Rush
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cold Rush is a competitive adventure premiering at Gary Con 2020. It takes place in the Critical Role Exandria campaign setting on the continent of Wildemount, has a 4-hour duration, and uses six pregenerated characters of 5th-level.

This adventure has different groups playing at the same time, trying to achieve various objectives and getting scored on the outcome. The group with the most points is declared the winner and receives a special reward, but everyone gets a reward for playing and the main objective of the game is the same as it ever was, fun.

User summary:

Distributed as three PDF files:

41-page scenario
24-page print-and-play, pre-generated characters
2-page adventure certificate

boardgame.name: A Blinking Light
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Blinking Light is a competitive adventure for the six 7th-level pregenerated characters included with the adventure. Using characters other than those provided is not allowed in sanctioned play, since the characters are designed to fit specifically into the story and encounters of the adventure.

Players participating in the event earn rewards that can be applied to one D&D Adventurers League Oracle of War campaign character. Rewards can only be applied to a single Oracle of War character, as described on the official reward certificate provided to players at the end of this event (see appendix C).

The event run time is 4 hours, including a short time at the end of the event for scores to be tallied and winners announced.

User summary:

The scenario is distributed as two PDF files:

26-page scenario
25-page print-and-play, pre-generated characters

boardgame.name: Henchman's Story
boardgame.description:
Henchman Story is a visual novel where you play as a beleaguered henchman working for a bumbling supervillain.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: A Memoir Blue
boardgame.description:
A Memoir Blue is an atmospheric journey through the memories of Miriam: a champion swimmer, who on the day of her greatest success dwells on her childhood memories of her mother and a special trip they took.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: The Phantom: The Card Game – Stamus Contra Malum
boardgame.description:
A side-mission where the player gets the chance to unlock 6 new allies and the Jungle Patrol headquarters. This adventure is thematically suited to the adventure Diana in The Jungle Patrol, but can be played along with any The Phantom: the Card Game adventures.

Side-Missions are mini-adventure that can be played in parallel with adventure, they unlock new cards for the player and add one more thing to take care of.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land
boardgame.description:
Post Mortem LA: Death in La La Land is a narrative mystery game inspired by the game Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

This case centers around the unveiling of a new rollercoaster in La-La Land that goes tragically wrong when mayoral candidate Bradley Rideout flies right out of his seat and into Pirate Poppy’s Popcorn Stand. Is this a tragic fairground mishap or carefully planned foul play? It is up to you to figure out who is behind it is all - before you yourself become La-La Land’s next high-flying victim.

boardgame.name: Post Mortem LA: Lucha Muerte
boardgame.description:
Lucha Muerte is a narrative mystery game inspired by SHCD.

Set in 1940’s Los Angeles, you will take on the role of probationary cautionary auxiliary investigator at the Global Detective Agency and assist them on the case. All the files you need will be sent to your door, including a map of your jurisdiction and pertinent evidence. It will be yours to investigate, follow leads, interrogate suspects, study the clues, and solve the murder. Once you think you have the answers, you can write them on the Final Report included in the box, then break the seal to read the resolution and find out if you were successful in your investigation.

The case:

The door of El Santo Niño church flies open, and two shotgun blasts resound in the hall. Horrified witnesses report a gunman wearing a red cape and mask. Now El Angel Rojo — luchador and hero of Chavez Ravine — sits in a jail cell downtown, charged with double murder…

boardgame.name: Meer-Fahrt vor 3000 Jahren
boardgame.description:
The game is based on the following idea: A number of Greek youths and maidens intend to visit the "Island of Friendship". Each player initially receives 30 tokens, of which he pays 10 into the till. If the cash runs out during the game, each player pays in another 10 tokens. The Players take turns to roll and move. The ships depart from space A, but are immediately caught up in a storm that pushes the vessels in different directions until the player manages to get past space B or C. From then on, the ship follows the chosen direction until it finally reaches space
A again to win the game.

If a ship comes to a green space, the player receives as many tokens from the till as his roll counted eyes. If he comes to a red space, he has to pay the same amount into the till. If a player is unable to make their payments, it means "shipwreck"; he receives a lifeboat and swaps his previous colored ship for a black one. With this he may continue to move; he is waived from paying twice if he stands on red. If he gets into payment difficulties again, this boat sinks and the player is eliminated from the game.

Scylla and Charybdis: As before, the player advances his ship by the number of columns equal to the number of eyes he rolled, but must place himself on the square of the column in question that shows the same number of eyes as his roll.
Friendship Island: In front of the island there are two squares to jump over. If unsuccessful, the attempt must be repeated the next time. If ships coming from different directions meet on the island, they share their wealth equally among themselves.
Vortex: The player stays around the circle with his ship until he comes to one of the exit spaces.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Mythic Magazine (Volume 16 - Mar 2022)
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Variations: Location Crafting Random Cities
What If: Mythic And Crafter House Rules

boardgame.name: Double Donkey
boardgame.description:
You are all donkeys. Sorry, that's how it is in this game. But being a donkey is not bad, there are plenty of others. But still, nobody wants to be the biggest donkey. So you better choose the right dice, risk a bit and quickly get rid of your donkey cards!

Gameplay:
Each player is dealt a deck of 10 cards. The decks are placed face down in front of each player and everyone draws 3 cards from it.

Dice Phase: Roll the six dice. Choose a die and set it aside.
The next person rolls the remaining five dice and sets one aside, and so on...until all dice results are determined.

Card Phase: Now all players simultaneously must play 1-3 donkey-cards from their hand. The numbers on the dice determine the value of the cards (colors of the donkey-cards = value of the color dice).
The player with the highest card-value is the "biggest donkey" in this round and cannot discard his cards.
All other players draw new cards from their own decks.

Game end:
The first player to get rid of his deck (of 10 cards) is the winner!

boardgame.name: An Empty Throne
boardgame.description:
An Empty Throne is a two player card game pitting players against each other to unite the lands under their own rule and secure their claim to the throne. An Empty Throne was designed to be quick playing and accessible. With a basic understanding of the card types, their roles, and their parts, the game can be played using the Player Reference cards and prompts on The Tombs and Field cards.

In this quick playing, combo driven game, players use their two Actions each turn to play (or move/exchange) Kith cards from their hand to the three Fields and The Tombs to acquire additional Kith cards and/or trigger abilities, create coalitions, secure the Fields, and score points.

On a player’s turn, they must select two of the following Actions, and may not select the same Action twice in a single turn:
Play one card from their hand to their side of The Tombs or a Field*.
Play one card from their hand to their side of a Field*.
Move one of their played cards to a different Field or The Tombs and the player draws the top card of the moved-to deck.

When the game ends, players score points:

2 points for each of their flipped Fields
1 point for each Field where they have at least 12 Value
2 points if they have at least 12 Value at The Tombs
1 point for each revealed Refuge Bonus Kith card in their hand.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – The Long Quest
boardgame.description:
As the armies of Karasu closed in on us, I remembered our past adventures in the palaces of Pajan, seeking to unmask the Oni hidden among the hosts... What I wouldn't have given for some of our old allies to come to our aid!

This expansion is primarily intended for owners of the two games Okko Chronicles - Cycle of Water and Cycle of Earth and their expansions. It aims to allow the use of part of the Cycle of Water material in the Cycle of Earth and vice versa.

This expansion provides material to use some of the Cycle of Water figures in the Cycle of Earth:

- An Identity Card for Tikku, his Initiative Card and his 8 Action Cards
- Identity card for Eiko Bashimon, her Initiative card and her 8 Action cards
- Identity card for Anko Kaori, her Initiative card and her 8 Action cards
- An Identity Card for Ninjas
- Identity Card for Oni Yama
- An Identity Card for Oni Kage

It also provides materials to use some of the Cycle of Earth miniatures in the Cycleof Water:

- An Identity card for the Bushi
- An Identity Card for the Archers
- Identity card for the Fire Faces
- An Identity Card for the Taishö
- An identity card for Mitsu Hatori

Finally, this expansion offers a great campaign using the material of the 2 previous Okko Chronicles games:

- 1 Campaign Book of 80 pages
- 1 Pajan Map
- 1 Time token, with a Day / Night side
- 20 Food / Koku counters
- 9 Reputation counters numbered from 01 to 09 (1 Execrable, 2 and 3 Doubtful, 4, 5 and 6 Uncertain, 7 and 8 Honorable and 9 Excellent)
- 6 Bashimon Clan counters (or cards), with the same front side but 3 corrupted Clan sides and 3 uncorrupted Clan sides
- 12 Object cards
- 1 calendar card

The campaign book is based on the campaign "Adventure in Pajan" available for free on BGG. It will be largely modified and completed in order to integrate the scenarios of the Earth Cycle and to allow an even greater immersion in the Pajan universe. This booklet allows to link a large number of unpublished scenarios or spread in the different boxes and extensions of the Water Cycle and Earth Cycle to create a huge campaign using more than 50 different scenarios and quests.

In the course of their adventure, Heroes will travel across much of the empire, from the cold city of the Silver Silks to the azure seas of the south to the snowy mountains of the 7 Monasteries range. Depending on the circumstances, their choices, their successes (or failures), the sequence of scenarios will be completely different, allowing for a unique adventure.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Earth – Ramparts of the Empire
Okko Chronicles: Cycle of Water – Quest into Darkness

boardgame.name: Unique Locations: Collection 02
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Whether encountered on a quest, or simply found while traveling from here to there, feel free to add these unique locations to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:

A thatched cottage in a clearing, deep in the forest
A stone tower rising from behind a wooden cottage
Strange entries in a journal, in an abandoned manor house
Stonework stairs and wall, leading up from a natural cavern system

boardgame.name: New Players Starter Pack: Ideas Inc.
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Interested in getting started with Mutants and Masterminds? Look no further! This book is a supplement for Mutants and Masterminds 3rd Edition that provides New Players with a team of 4 pre-made Heroes for them to jump right into play. This book revolves around Ideas Incorporated, a government-backed superhero team made up of Dr. Discovery, Captain Alpha, Dragoon the Flying Fortress, and Basilisk, King of the Reptiles who help defend America from threats to the country and its citizens.

Includes:

4 detailed Character Sheets with artwork to encourage new Players to find the character that works best for them.
Detailed explanations of the Character's powers and how they might be used
A background and relationship dossier for new Players to get into character and roleplay effectively.

boardgame.name: The Between: Season Three
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Season 3 of The Between expands the innovative game of gothic horror with a new playbook, a new Mastermind, and 6 new Threats. You must have a copy of The Between to use this material.

Details of what you'll find in Season 3:

The Legacy A new hunter has arrived at Hargrave House! [Insert Smash Bros. new ﬁghter meme] !e Legacy is a classic monster hunter character, inspired by Van Helsing, Castlevania, Bloodborne, etc. Everyone at Hargrave House is a monster hunter, but !e Legacy was literally born to do it. !ey are trying to escape their family's brutal, bloody past, but not before they take down the Beast, a creature that has tormented their bloodline for generations.

The Beast The Beast is a new threat associated with The Legacy playbook. It's unique from other threats in the game in that it's largely undeﬁned in the beginning. The player of The Legacy actually holds onto the sheet until it's time to face The Beast, and they ﬁll in the details throughout play, much as the Keeper ﬁlls out details on the Mastermind sheet. In fact, The Beast is very much like a "mini-Mastermind."

Titania, Queen of the Fae A new Mastermind. Titania has had her power stolen by Queen Victoria, and so she's assembled a human "fae court" to help her get it back. She will stop at nothing to destroy the duplicitous Widow at Windsor, and it will be up to Hargrave House to put a stop to her plans. Titania challenges the game's assumptions about the Mastermind always relying on wealth and intellect to enact their schemes. Rather, Titania is a street person—a queen brought low—who relies on her knowledge of the ancient and hidden world to torment the empire.

The Reaver's Last Victim This is the game's ﬁrst Side Threat. A Side Threat is introduced like a regular Threat, but it is investigated in a diﬀerent way or has stakes beyond death and destruction. The Reaver's Last Victim is about the last, unfound victim of Roger the Reaver, a notorious killer who was a member of Hargrave House (you can explore a bit of Roger's history in the main game via Hargrave House's conservatory).

The Beadle This is a hyper-localized Threat, taking place entirely in a single ﬂat. It's about a man who has changed into a giant insect. The stakes are much more emotional in nature, though there is a distinct danger that the insect-man's brood may start to spread across the city…

The Shoreditch Slugger An underground ﬁghting club is thrown into disarray with the arrival of an unusually strong, unbeatable ﬁghter, nicknamed the Shoreditch Slugger. Hargrave House has no interest in boxing matches, but a hint that the Slugger's power might come ftom a supernatural source gets their attention.

The Miasma of Miswell Hill The Miswell Hill rookery is being tormented by a strange, poisonous miasma. Hargrave House investigates to determine if the source is supernatural in nature, or something entirely more horrifying: a mundane device to kill the poor. The rookery in this beautifully-researched Threat is like an entire setting all its own.

The Drowned Guardian of the Docks An aquatic demon has been spotted near the docks, but is it actually a malevolent spirit, or is it something else? Perhaps it's a misunderstood guardian of some sort. This new Threatwas the winner of our recently-held writing contest. It has beautiful details, and incorporates themes related to labor rights (and like Miswell Hill, is almost an entire setting unto itself).

boardgame.name: Fool's Fancy: Spells for Tricksters and Mischief Makers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I simply don't see the point of being an all-powerful master of the arcane if you can't have a little fun with it once in a while."
- Marreltok Physan, traveling wizard

Across the continent and throughout the realms, there are a variety of influential and powerful beings devoted to the domains of whimsy, trickery, and mischief. From deities who spend countless eons pranking their fellow gods to otherworldly patrons injecting their own brand of monkeyshines into the lives of hapless mortals, these powerful entities have inspired a plethora of festivals and holidays created to celebrate (or ward away) their particular senses of humor.
But whether through direct intervention or simply acting as muses to the magically-inclined, the most powerful impact that these eternal jokesters have had by far is on the spell books of fun-loving casters.

The following are new spells for characters who don't mind mixing a little nonsense and tomfoolery into their magical repertoires. As with all new play options, please consult your Game Master to verify that these spells mesh well with the vision and direction of their game.

This supplement includes:

5 new April Fool's-inspired spells

boardgame.name: Monolith Mystery
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Desert treks usually bring a whole lotta sand, but every once and a while something interesting pops up!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a four, third level PCs.

boardgame.name: The Devil is in the Details
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Originally Created for the 2018 Nordalian Tournament in Green Bay, WI, Hellebarde has reworked the original to offer a version for OSRIC and C&C,.

You and your fellow mercenaries have been sent here to Traders’ Rest to hunt down Ogres that are menacing the trade route.

It seems like a simple Ogre problem… But the fate of the world is at stake.

GM: This module contains three self-contained adventures at three separate levels that are linked in the module, but can be played separately. The pre-generated characters cover the levels of all three modules (1st-2nd, 5th-6th, and 9th-10th). It also contains the definition of the Kingdom of Frendall - counties, nobles, people, etc. ready to drop into your gaming world.
boardgame.rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)

boardgame.name: And the Deep Blue Sea
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party may have met its match in the form of sea creatures on the planet Kanaloa that have targeted an oceanborne reclamation facility for attack. As the casualties mount, the PCs struggle to keep the creatures in check and find the reason for their aggression. But that reason might have nothing to do with the animals’ normal behavior. What is motivating them to violence? And will the heroes’ efforts to find out also make them victims?

And the Deep Blue Sea is a short adventure for Cepheus Deluxe, Cepheus Engine, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying game. Other 2D6 systems can easily be adapted.

boardgame.name: Fauxlio
boardgame.description:
As Trainee Librarians of the Literary Canon Conservatoire, you were under explicit instruction not to touch the “Recent Arrivals” crate. Instructions someone failed to follow.

Now you and the other Trainee Librarians have one measly vat of PLOT GLUE and however long a Senior Auditor takes for lunch to fix the mess you’ve made. Using your ingenuity and talents you’ll have to work together to save these classic books. Paste in characters that at least appear to fit, without losing too many characters and books in your slapdash gluing fiesta, and you might just save the day!

Fauxlio is a fully cooperative game for 1-4 players. You and the other players are Trainee Librarians. Your goal is to sparingly use your PLOT GLUE to fill books with characters that can take on the roles of the missing (that is, they match at least 1 of the original's roles) before the books become too gummed up with the residual glue of wandering characters.

When a book's character spots are all filled, it is complete. You read aloud its summary using the substituted characters, receive a glue rebate, and file the volume on the Bookshelf.

Each turn, you spill glue from the reserve onto the books remaining on the table. If you have to place glue in the last space of a book, that book is destroyed, and its glue is removed from the game.

The game ends in one of two ways. If you fill the Bookshelf, everyone wins. If you reach a point where you cannot add glue from the vat when needed, everyone loses.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Inside the Box Board Games LLP (ITB)

boardgame.name: Call of Kilforth: World Playmat
boardgame.description: A 986×576 mm playmat usable with regular or tarot-sized location cards. Exclusive to the Call of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game Kickstarter.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Call of Kilforth: A Fantasy Quest Game

boardgame.name: Reise durch Schlaraffien
boardgame.description:
After everyone has agreed on the amount of the bet, the order is determined by rolling the die. Since laziness is trumps in the Land of Cockaigne, the last ones naturally go first, that is, whoever has the lowest number of points begins. Those who have thrown an even number of eyes are assigned the right ribbon, the others the left, after which the game begins.

The players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 31 wins the Game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Bad to Worse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

As the survivors press on toward Camp Hope, fate provides them with a tremendous post-apocalyptic windfall… and equally tremendous dangers.

Bad to Worse is the sixth episode in The Living Dead Campaign. This unorthodox Savage Worlds Plot Point Campaign for Dead End takes your Novice survivor characters through the first year of the zombie apocalypse with a recurring series of monthly episodes that tell the gripping tale of fear and survival in a world claimed by the dead.

boardgame.name: Wild: Serengeti – Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Promo cards from the support the dice tower 2022 kickstarter. Two scene cards and two specialist cards.

The two specialists cards are the content creator and the influencer. The content creator will let you start the game with an additional 2 coin and 3 VFX tokens. The influencer lets you gain 2 points for each time you use a food token.

The scene cards are to be determined.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Deep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

HELP WILL NOT COME.

Something has gone terribly wrong on the Rimor 89. Crew are failing to report for duty, strange sounds are echoing throughout the vessel, and it feels as though the ocean itself is trying to eat the submarine alive. Can the remaining crew figure out whats happening? Or will the Rimor 89 end up as yet another wreck on the ocean floor?

EASY TO RUN, EASY TO PLAY

Alone In The Deep is designed for the easy to run Mothership RPG system (while being easy to convert to any other) and fits entirely on an a4 pamphlet. The adventure's layout is designed around being easy to read and run at a glance, making it an ideal module for GM's of any experience level.

This adventure can be used as a standalone oneshot, or as part of an ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Mascarade: Gamer Promo Card
boardgame.description:
A promo card that adds the Gamer mask into the deck.

The rules for it are as follows:

Take 3 Coins from the Bank and hide 1, 2, or 3 of them in your hand.

Then choose another player who must guess how many Coins are in your hand.

If the player guesses correctly, they gain those Coins.

If their guess is wrong, add these Coins to your wealth.

Any remaining Coins (that you didn’t hide in your hand)
are put back in the Bank.

boardgame.name: Segel-Regatta
boardgame.description:
The players choose a game master (GM) who accepts the registrations, raffles the starting places, directs the races and manages the till. The tools required are: 4 cruiser yachts (A), 4 racing yachts (B), 1 escort steamer (C) for the game master, 1 black and 1 white die and a large number of tokens.

It is at the discretion of the GM to organize races for cruiser yachts or races for racing yachts. The stake for the former is 20, for the latter 10 tokens. If more than 4 participants register for a race, preliminary races will be held; only the first and second winning boats take part in the main race. If there are still more than 4 participants, further elimination races are held.

The fairway for the yachts is marked by the colors yellow, red, green and blue, in addition, the white gully to the right of it is also part of the legal fairway.

The white die is used to advance on the track. On the roll of 3 or 6, the yacht goes straight ahead, with a roll of 2 or 5 the same number of spaces in the next right fairway, on 1 and 4 the number of spaces forward in the next left fairway.

If two yachts land on the same square, the one that is in the wrong fairway is eliminated from the race. If both meet in the wrong fairway, the one that is furthest away from its rightful fairway is eliminated. Furthermore, whoever comes off the racetrack, is eliminated too.

Any participant who believes that he is in danger of being eliminated may turn up on his lawful fairway as soon as it is his turn to throw the dice. He reports this intention to the GM, uses the black die and moves back as many squares as he rolls in the next fairway against his legal fairway. For each roll of the black die, 3 tokens must be paid into the till.

The goal has been reached if the player rolls at least one eye more than there are still spaces left up to the end line.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Zéro à 100
Zero to 100
boardgame.description:
A vaguely intelligent party game!

In Zero to 100, your challenge is not to be too far off target when answering trivia questions. Divide players into three teams and give each team six question cards at random. Each question has a numerical answer from 0 to 100 on its reverse side, but you can never look at the back of a question card until after you play it!

For the first round, place the 50 number card in the center of play. Each team chooses a question card in front of them that they think will be as close to 50 as possible. Once each team has chosen, reveal the numbers on the back of the cards. Whichever team was farthest away from 50 draws a new question card from the deck — while the other teams discard their question cards — then the number on the back of the losing team's question card becomes the new target number for the next round. Each team has three power cards, and you can play a power card with your question card to raise or lower your number by 50; raise or lower it by 20; or allow you to discard an extra question card should your answer be within 5 of the target number.

The first team to have only question card in front of them wins! If multiple teams go down to one question card at the same time, they each must guess the answer on their own question card, and whichever team is closest wins.

boardgame.description:
Promo card of the support the dice tower 2022 kickstarter. One seal card.

The seal card requires the rock and sand ground symbols and is worth 2 points. It will show the predator card symbol.

boardgame.name: Charcuterie: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
Break out your serving boards, cured meats, and accoutrements as you prepare to create a delicious display of eye-catching appetizers. Take turns drafting delectable food tiles and arranging them on your board, but carefully consider your placements, as you will be judged on your final presentation! Score points for your arrangement and for meeting social criteria that elevate your display into a real crowd pleaser. Charcuterie: The Board game is the perfect appetizer for every social event!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Dual Layer Player Boards
boardgame.description:
These player boards are made of 2 cardboard layers for a total thickness of 3 mm. The top layer is punched out so that it leaves space for your production parameter cubes and resource cubes. This helps keep them in place, even when you accidentally bump the table.

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition
Terraforming Mars: Ares Expedition – Discovery · Foundations · Crisis

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: Das Kartenspiel – Helden-Pack Spider-Ham
Marvel Champions: El Juego de Cartas – Spider-Ham Pack de Héroe
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Spider-Ham Hero Pack
boardgame.description:
Greetings, citizens! You’ve met high-flying heroes, super-genius scientists, and cosmic sorcerers. You’ve seen awe-inspiring Avengers, grandstanding Guardians, and wondrous Web-Warriors. Now, it’s time for the porcine powerhouse, the spectacular super-pig, the wacky web-slinger, the one and only…Spider-Ham! This cartoon wonder WHAMs his way into players’ games of Marvel Champions: The Card Game with zany aplomb. Utilizing his wacky cartoon physics and goofy antics, Spider-Ham can take hits like a champ and thwart villains’ schemes with all sorts of colorful nonsense. With this Hero Pack, players will find Spider-Ham, his fifteen signature cards, and a full assortment of Justice cards inviting them to ruin the villains’ plans. This pack also includes a bonus modular encounter set featuring the iconic and terrifying Inheritors.

For players ready to challenge the Sinister Six, they can get started with the Spider-Ham Hero Pack! This expansion comes with a 40-card pre-built deck, giving players the chance to start playing right out of the box.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

boardgame.name: Marvel Dice Throne: Captain Marvel v. Black Panther
boardgame.description:
In Marvel Dice Throne, you become one of eight of Marvel's most famous heroes, including Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, Scarlet Witch, Loki, Thor, Doctor Strange, and Miles Morales Spider-man! Every Marvel Dice Throne hero was painstakingly designed and balanced to provide the most thematic experience possible, allowing you to truly embody your favorite heroes like no other game. Featuring all-new mechanisms and asymmetrical designs, these are our most innovative and exciting heroes yet.

Marvel Dice Throne is a heart-pumping, fast-playing game of skilled card play and dice manipulation supporting multiple modes of play, including 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all.

Attack your opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).
All 8 heroes are compatible with the entire Dice Throne ecosystem
Use upgrade cards to improve your hero abilities as the game progresses
Play action cards strategically to manipulate dice and surprise your foe
Features a deluxe, highly functional, Battle Chest storage system
Each hero in the Battle Chest has their own beautiful set of custom swirl dice

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: War of the Magi
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What if sorcerers were real, and they were all around us? Would they hide their talents from us? Would they protect us or try to dominate us? Would they consider us equals or as lesser beings?

This book tries to answer those questions with a supplement for Dark Streets & Darker Secrets, an urban fantasy and action-horror game. Inspired by the sorcerer school series, the Highlander movies, and the World of Darkness games, War of the Magi focuses on sorcerous characters on the brink of war, dealing with supernatural threats and each other.

boardgame.name: Sagrahtzee
boardgame.description:
Sagrahtzee is an innovative, groundbreaking installment to the roll & write genre of parody game that comes to you fully playable via a free print-and-play! (the team couldn't bear dealing with another production cycle)

It's easy to learn and will take a lifetime to master (or at least what will feel like a lifetime). All you need to play the completely free game is a printer, paper, ink, a computer, a copy of Sagrada, and 6 colored pencils! (Or Crayons, we won't judge)
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Sagrada

boardgame.name: A Little Dinghy
boardgame.description:
You have just been made captain of the failing merchant ship Cat o’ Nine Sails. Congratulations! Unfortunately, you may have celebrated too much; you have a series of deliveries due all over the archipelago in a few short days, and in your revelry you managed to destroy your only set of maps. You need to figure out where you are headed, and fast, or else… well, the previous captain did not exactly retire.

In A Little Dinghy, one or two players work together to re-build a map and plot a successful trade route. Each turn, one player must add a card to the map, making sure to obey certain restrictions. Once all cards have been placed, the players must be able to trace a trade route across all the islands in the map that doesn't cross over itself. There is, however, one catch; the players must keep all cards in their hands at all times, including the map itself. If a player ever lets a card drop, they immediately lose the game. If players can build the map successfully and plot out their trade route, they win the game!

In addition to the base game, A Little Dinghy comes with nine scenarios that add unique rules and challenges to the game, and a career mode that can be used to chain multiple games into a campaign.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Battle of Dunstop Castle
boardgame.description:
Dunstop Castle is of course that fortress at the northwest portion of your Dragon Pass map in the Lunar Empire next to Jaldon's Wrong River at the end of the road from Goldedge. In a major offensive by the Sartar, Dunstop had to be taken within three days. Did they succeed? We're not sure, the history is vague on this point. What we have done is set up the situation as it was for you to find out what may have happened. You can play it out and decide for yourself whether the Sartar succeeded in taking Dunstop before finally being driven out by the superior army from Furthest.

--publisher description

A small-format two mapsheet game of fantasy combat in, around, and under Castle Dunstop. The game is 22 turns long, which includes daytime and nighttime turns. The winner is the player whose forces occupy the inner tower of the castle at the end of the game.

Set in the Glorantha realm and inspired by the rules of White Bear & Red Moon. Published in the Wyrm's Footnotes newsletter, issue #3.

--user summary

boardgame.name: Supply Chain: the card game
boardgame.description:
A combination of Tetris, rummy, Sim City, and dominos. Buy properties and build your business empire. But make sure all your suppliers are linked, or it can all fall apart.

Each player starts with a main office and a family business. Players buy, sell, and trade properties to grow a sprawling cityscape. All cards have links so you may connect a producer with its suppliers. Watch out for run-down derelict properties that your competitors might stick on you.

When all the properties are gone, the game is over. Players add up their victory points to determine the winner. Different properties vary in point values. An iron mine might have only 1 VP while the coveted Department Store has 10 VP.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Von der Erdenscheybe
boardgame.description:
Von der Erdenscheybe is a four-player version of Kosakenschubsen, the hand-crafted finger flicking game by Dieter Zander from Historische Spiele Zander, published at Essen Spiel 2012. All 4 participants play against each other. Again, it's about pushing the opponents off the board and trying to get to the middle of the game by advancing and thus winning. However, the board is designed in a completely different way: You now have a square board, which has a slope in the middle and ups and downs distributed over the board, creating natural "safety bunkers". In the beginning you can only hit the outermost discs of your neighbors directly, for everything else you have to make use of the round peg in the center of the board, and cleverly and accurately calculate the rebound.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Vindication: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Cards
boardgame.description:
Two promo cards ("Monocle of the Illustrious" and "Adornment of the Patriarch") which were available as a reward for the 2022 Dice Tower Kickstarter.

Monocle of the Illustrious (Loot): Dilute 1 Power.

Adornment of the Patriarch (Relic): Return 1 influence from this card and a compansion, gain +1 speed this turn.

boardgame.name: The Scaled Job
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

The Scaled Job! Kobold Burglars run amok! A short, one-shot adventure in the world of Zephyr – Tales from the Void. It can easily be adapted for any campaign setting.

Strange rumblings have been happening in the city of Lauzarbach and the Commonwealth citizens are starting to get a little nervous. As the quakes grow in strength, the people of Downingwood Street reach out to the Agents for help. Can they solve the mystery of the shaking streets before its too late? This explosive Dieselpunk adventure is intended for 5e characters of 2nd to 4th level. Inside you will find: – 6 New Monsters including the crafty Kazzixi clan kobolds – Two new traps – Rules for a new way to run encounters: Trials – Links to our World Anvil portal with tons of free stuff! – And an entire evening of fun and excitement for your players!

boardgame.name: Cryptocodex
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Cryptocodex is an 80+ page dossier containing over 50 new critters –benign and

malevolent – to enhance your post-apocalyptic roleplaying game. Designed to integrate easily into any Dungeon Crawl Classics or Mutant Crawl Classics setting, this book brings monsters from the minds of Ian McGarty, Jayson "Rocky" Gardner, Tristen Green, and Skeeter Green. Featuring artwork from Wonkee, Ed Bickford, Ala Fedorova, and Johnathan Bingham, let these creatures loose in your game today!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Brinebreak
boardgame.description: A 5e adventure for 3-7 level 3 PCs.

boardgame.name: Cthulhu Wars: Smell like a Monster
boardgame.description:
Four Monstrous Air Fresheners that can have your car, boat, RV, inner sanctum, byakhee, or hovercraft smelling fresh as the day it was made/summoned.

Not only do these smell great, but you can also use them in your games of Cthulhu Wars.

Naturally you can use these Air Fresheners as special fragrant additions in Cthulhu Wars! Just download their Loyalty Cards and find a standee! Remember: there is always space for more Cthulhu Wars]!

(Standee bases not included, neither was playtesting.)

This is a one-time only event that runs from April 1, 2022, through Midnight April 4.

boardgame.name: Knightfall: A Daring Journey
boardgame.description:
Two knights, a strong bond, and a long journey. Take up the race for the rose, ride from village to village and take shelter before nightfall by any means necessary.

If your bond is strong and your horse drifts well, you can be the recipient of the fabled rose. Luckily you brought guns!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Cosmic Convoy
boardgame.description:
“The computer is going berserk, Captain! Our charges are exhausted, and we need to collect new ones, but the computers starting to spit out random code. I'm worried that it’s going to shoot us off the ship if we go to collect the new charges from the generators.

This was supposed to be a simple delivery! Who designed this ship?!?!”

Construct your ship using the deck and collect all of your charges (crystals or cubes) using your crew(meeples) before the modules of your ship flip; possibly sending your charges and crew into space.

Can you recharge the engines and get your crew home safely?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Seven Ravens
boardgame.description:
A fairly simple abstract strategy game for two with a Nordic feel, which combines elements of hnefatafl and chess. Stated to be a traditional folk game with rules handed down in the family, when marketed online, but it appears not to have been previously recorded.

Played on a square wooden board, divided into 7×7 undifferentiated squares (the game can also be played on an 8×8 chess board).

One player takes 6 light / natural coloured discs, termed ravens, and sets them up in one corner of the board, one in the very corner, another in each of the adjacent squares, and the remaining three in the squares adjacent to those. The opponent takes six dark / stained discs, and similarly sets them up in the opposite corner. Each player's specially marked disc, termed Odin's Raven, is placed at the head of this flock. Players then take turns in moving one of their ravens, with the aim of winning the game by capturing all of the opposing ravens.
Odin's raven moves like a knight in chess, and captures by landing on an opposing disc. Other ravens move like chess rooks, and capture by flanking an opposing disc, as in hnefatafl. Odin's raven may also participate in these flanking captures.
There are several slight variants with differing movement / capturing rules.

boardgame.name: Roma aeterna
boardgame.description:
Roma aeterna is a strategic game for four players aged 14 and over with a historical background.

The game is based on the eventful history of Italy and its peoples in the period from 290 BC to 1140 AD. At the beginning of the game, the players are assigned certain peoples according to their game colour. Some of these peoples are already on the board at the beginning of the game, others are added in the course of the game.

A Roma aeterna game lasts about four to six hours and comprises a total of 16 game rounds.

Within the individual game rounds, the players continuously collect victory points for the successful execution of certain actions and for the possession of certain territories by their peoples. The winner of the game is the player who has scored the most victory points with his or her peoples at the end of game round 16.

Roma aeterna is a game in the so-called Britannia style. So if you like games in this style, you will love Roma aeterna...

listing.notes: The publisher of Roma aeterna, Ars Strategica, has thankfully authorized me, as a co-designer of the game, to sell some copies of the first edition via Geek Market. Please keep in mind that the first edition has been published in German. Customs costs or other additional costs have to be borne by the buyer.

boardgame.name: Flu Season Dice Game
boardgame.description: A companion dice game to the original card game about staying healthy while eliminating others by getting them sick. Roll the dice to determine if you gain or lose heart tokens, the life point tracking mechanism for you turn. Then repeat process. Optional rules allow you to play with character powers and different game play styles.

boardgame.name: Hordes of Power
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Isle of Prymal, spelled with a "Y", so you know it's bad a$$. Once, long ago, the isle was home to a technologically advanced super civilization that utterly destroyed itself... and from the ashes arose the barbaric and beautiful land of Prymal as we know it today. A land of enigmatic prophecy, where it has been foretold that peace will only return when a champion of destiny arises and assembles a legendary Horde of Power: a fabled force with the strength of 25 mountains! Are YOU that champion of destiny? Do you have what it takes to build a Horde of Power and rule the Isle of Prymal?

Can you assemble and lead an army of heroes, villains, monsters, robots, pirates, sorcerers, and ex-girlfriends, all the while fending off your opponent's attempts to weaken your forces through murder, kidnapping, and brainwashing?

boardgame.name: Aggretsuko Office Rage Card Game
boardgame.description: Be the first to empty your hand by placing Coworker Cards in the workspace to make or add onto sets and sequences. The first player in each round to empty their hand gets to flip a Karaoke Token, and a new round begins. Flip three Karaoke Tokens to win this fast-paced game!

boardgame.name: Inundo
boardgame.description:
Players use developmental measures in the form of different cards to protect houses on a map against flooding.

Each round you gain income to pay for these measures and new cards. On top of that, there is an event card affecting all players. At the end of each round different houses along the rivers are flooded in certain patterns that are determined by dice roll. Every house that wasn't protected by you specifically (multiple people can protect the same house) gives you one negative point.

After 6 rounds you want to be the person with the least amount of negative points. Additionally, there are win conditions for having ecological and aesthetic points on your measure cards. Finally, after the end of the main game every player gives a speech about their protection efforts. Everyone then votes on the best speech, which is the third component for determining who wins the game.

boardgame.name: Kieszonkowy Detektyw: Seria 1
Pocket Detective: Season 1
boardgame.description:
In the Pocket Detective game series, players take the role of investigators trying to get to the bottom of tangled cases and mysterious stories. Gather clues, interrogate suspects, perform arrests and identify evidence to successfully solve the case.

On their turn, each player chooses an available card to investigate. These cards can represent a Clue, a Location, Witness Interrogation, Special Action, Arrest of a Suspect, etc. Players will discover what actually happened by investigating leads on these cards. The objective is to solve a case in a minimum number of turns.

Pocket Detective Season 1 includes three cooperative card-based cases which will test your deduction for 1-6 players, ages 10+.
Test your investigative skills with three criminal cases: “Murder at the University,” “Dangerous Liaisons,” and “Time is Running Out.”

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Machinika: Museum
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

Machinika Museum is a mystery game where you discover beautiful and mysterious machines of extra-terrestrial origins in an atmospheric galaxy-spanning 3D puzzle game. Will you be able to understand their stories and discover what happened to their previous owner?

boardgame.name: Family Feud: Late Night Edition
boardgame.description:
It’s time to put your mind in the gutter and answer survey questions that might make someone blush. But it’s all in good fun, with questions like: “We asked 100 Women, Name something your husband wishes was bigger” … “At what age do most men suffer a midlife crisis?” … “What word or phrase might a partner whisper in your ear to be romantic?” … “Name a sure giveaway that a couple has just been doing some heavy petting.” You get the picture. So now let’s get down and dirty with the game that may get a rise out of you. Late Night Family Feud is recommended for 3 or more players, ages 16 and up.

• Includes: 200 Face Off Cards, 1 Emcee Card, 1 Dry Erase Scoreboard, 1 Dry Erase Marker, 1 Instruction sheet

boardgame.name: Wildlands Bestiary
boardgame.description:
A guide to the flora and fauna of the Wildlands.
Nine monsters and fourteen plant creatures are described. These creatures are part of the Dwarven Forge mini line.
- User summary

boardgame.name: Cat Traveler In Asia
傻猫去旅行
boardgame.description:
The Theme
Travel all over Asia to complete Mission.

Game-Play
Players will travel through eight places in Asia.Whoever has the most points wins.
At the beginning, each player has two travel cards and chooses a place as the starting point,they can use the tool card on that place.

1.When it comes to your turn, first draw two travel cards,
2.discard the travel cards to go to other nearby places, but if you are directly adjacent, it is free, and then you need 1 card for each step.

3.Going to this place will trigger the square work tool card below. If the player does not want to trigger the tool card, they can choose to grab a travel card instead.
Then, you can play a travel card with a place at hand to complete the task.

4.Then, you can play Unlimited travel cards with a place at hand to complete the task.

move to other player until who have got 5 missions.

after a round end,the second player will become first player.
(In addition, the event card is an expansion accessory. you can add event cards to make the game more fun. There will be an event every round start, Events affect everyone,and players can use the event to win.)

Goal Of The Game
A player completes five Missions, and the game ends in that round. Whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Rangers of Shadow Deep: Reap the Whirlwind
boardgame.description:
A scenarios for rangers level 0.
Designed for Dwarven Forge's Wildlands using the Explore the Mountain set.

Three days ago, your small team slipped past the enemy sentries that guarded their front lines. Since then, you’ve moved from shadow to shadow, striking at isolated patrols, ambushing supply wagons, and making note of troop movements and concentrations. Despite your success, an uneasy feeling
has grown upon you. The weather has shifted. The breeze has picked up and dark clouds have slowly gathered; clouds that are all-too reminiscent of the Shadow Deep itself. You are just about to bring the mission to an end and return home when you see a strange flash of light on a distant mountainside.
Setting your weariness aside, you command your small team to move towards the light, leaving behind the safety of the tree cover, and advancing through the boulder-strewn fields at the foot of the mountains. The breeze continues to grow as you slip closer, carrying with it the sounds of tearing earth and cracking stone. Cresting a ridge, you peer into a rocky depression and gasp at the sight. In the midst of a rocky bowl, a column of light glows brightly. Unable to look directly at it, you can’t be sure if it is fire or some magical energy. Around this flaming pylon, four robed
figures stand upon hunks of rock, floating some 6 or 7 feet above the ground. The rocks move in slow circles around the pylon, while the figures riding them chant and make strange gestures.
You have no idea what all of this means, or what these wizards are attempting, but you suspect it may have something to do with the gathering storm. Regardless, whatever it is cannot prove good for Alladore. It’s only as you prepare to move into attack the wizards that you notice the gnoll sentries standing at various points around the circle…
boardgame.rpg: Rangers of Shadow Deep: A Tabletop Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Doom's Compendium of Pain
boardgame.description:
A collection of traps based on Dwarven Forge terrain tiles using D&D 5e rules.
written by "Doom the Imp"
--User summary

boardgame.name: Dreadhollow Forest
Wildlands Part 1
boardgame.description:
Contains two adventures:
Death Druids of Dreadhollow by Elye Alexander
and Tales of Woe by Teos Abadia

Death Druids of Dreadhollow by Elye Alexander
For 3-5 3rd level characters
Summary:

A cult of death-druids plot and scheme in the wilderness just beyond a remote rural town. When one of the town’s hunters goes missing, the party is tasked with finding them and in doing so come to clash with the cult itself. In the end, the group find themselves in direct confrontation with the cult’s powerful patron: a mad Fae lord. Can they survive the cult’s machinations, and save this remote outpost from the power of the Fae?
-- Publisher blurb

Tales of Woe by Teos Abadia
For 3-5 5th level characters
Summary:

An evil spider creature named Chelicerae Woespinner manipulates ancient elven sites of power, using their arcane energies to corrupt Dreadhollow Forest. As the heroes learn of the corruption, they rush to find the ruins and undo the dark rituals. Deep in the forest they may confront the villain and end her threat.
-- Publisher blurb

boardgame.name: Arcadia (Issue 13 - Feb 2022)
boardgame.description:
Arcadia
Issue 13
February 2022

boardgame.name: A Tome of Chaos
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

It’s said that magic is equal parts art, chaos, and science. at it’s a blessing, a curse, and progress itself. rough the notes of escaped Nilfgaardian Director of Magic, Glynnis var Treharne, you’ll put that saying to the test, uncovering the secrets of the primal forces of magic. How will you use this primordial chaos, and how will it change you?

A Tome of Chaos is a supplement for the Witcher TRPG which gives you a number of new spells, invocations, rituals, and hexes as well as a collection of magic items, dark rituals, and magical miscellanea to take your game to new heights.

Key Endorsement Causes Race in AZ to Tighten - The party behind AZ (when this card is revealed) places 2 registered voters to AZ.

The player who revealed this card draws 1 extra card.

Note: Requires Green Party Expansion.

boardgame.name: Legs, paws or hooves
Ноги, лапи чи копита
boardgame.description:
It started a long time ago. Apparently, when someone planted a mine in the middle of the yard. Or when someone broke a neighbor's fence…

Players take turns moving cards or using the properties of one of their cards and destroying opponents' cards. When no one can make a move, the game ends and the one with the lowest sum of lost cards' prices wins.

—description from the designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Băo Huáng
boardgame.description:
This Chinese climbing game for five players is said to have originated in Shandong province, and in the early 21st century it has become popular across a wide area of northern China and online. Băo huáng (保皇) means 'protect the emperor', and the game is also often known as dìwáng (帝王) meaning 'emperor'. In each deal two players, the emperor and his protector the eunuch (xiao baozi: 小孢子), play against a team of three, the farmers or people (ping min: 平民). The emperor and the eunuch are the holders of particular cards. While the emperor is known from the start, his protector remains hidden until the card is played.

As in all climbing games the object is to get rid of one's cards (and help one's partners to do so) by playing them singly or in combinations, where each play must beat the previous play.

There are five players and a pack of 168 cards is used. This can be constructed from four standard 52-card packs from which the 3's, 4's and 5's are removed plus four red jokers and four black jokers. Suits are irrelevant in this game, and the cards rank from high to low:

Red joker, Black joker, 2, A, K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6.

One red joker and one black joker are marked on the front, and the holders of these two cards will be the emperor and the eunuch respectively. Although standard Anglo-American cards can be used, the game is sufficiently popular that special 168-card packs can be obtained for this game with the emperor and eunuch cards ready printed.

boardgame.name: The Sunken Crypt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Where the worlds break, and the light descends.
The darkness encroaches within the ever-descending tunnel.
Where the hidden crypt lays – hope dwindles and then disappears.

THIS ADVENTURE is for Novice/Adept characters. The module is written for Symbaroum, starting in Thistle Hold and exploring in Davokar Forest and leading to The Sunken crypt.

boardgame.name: 100 Hooks and Rumours to Hear in Symbaroum
boardgame.description:
Characters may come across rumours and pieces of information when asking around and this supplement has a list of 100 such they could hear. Whether or not any particular rumour is true or not is up to the GameMaster. These hooks and rumours can be used to add background colour or be a potential source of adventure hooks.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

The Artisan's District of Yndaros was for some time in turmoil, after the Queen decided a guild system be installed, as various individual competed for the master and grandmaster seals of the different guilds. Many of the survivors left, which resulted in the bloody fighting dying down, but recently there are rumours it's started up again, albeit in a more subtle way, with coordinated programmes of assassination being carried out against certain candidates.
The bandit ogre known as Mound has a gang of goblins and tamed rage trolls and causes problems in the area around Yndaros. Recently, it seems that the ogre has recruited, or perhaps intimidated, more followers into joining him, increasing the size of his group and enabling him to cause more destruction and go after bigger targets.
The barbarian clans sometimes war amongst themselves, but haven't done in some time due to the arrival of the Ambrians and the various threats from Davokar. However, some Ambrians think that they would be better served if the clans did start to attack each other again, weakening them overall, and are looking into ways of provoking an inter-clan war.
The barbarians of clan Odaiova control the land between Thistle Hold and Karvosti, and profit from the travellers who pass through their land and those who trade between the Ambrians and the clans. There's a rumour that Embersind, the clan chieftain, is looking to be granted an honorary title by Queen Korinthia, one that gives him authority over lesser titles but which doesn't mean he gives up any independence.
The beacon in Thistle Hold has been the target of attacks by citizens who have been bribed to do so on a number of occasions. There's a rumour that another attempt to burn the beacon down was only just stopped recently, and that this attempt was far more organised than any of the previous ones, suggesting those who wish to see the beacon destroyed are putting more resources into their attempts.

(drive thru description)

boardgame.name: Barbarian Kingdoms
boardgame.description:
"Gold is the lifeblood of the war!"

As the Hun horde swept across Europe, they forced the Germanic tribes into exodus. These warlike peoples spread within the borders of the Western Empire and, by dint of looting and war, will eventually cause the collapse of the Empire. In the twilight of Antiquity and at the dawn of the Middle Ages, the so-called "barbarian nations" founded kingdoms on the former imperial territory.

In Barbarian Kingdoms, an asymmetrical and competitive strategy game, each player controls his own nascent kingdom and competes for supremacy over Western Europe. The first player to control seven territories or to eliminate two opposing kings wins the game.

In turn, each player chooses and resolves a single action of their choice:

Recruitment: deploy a warrior from the reserve by paying a cost
Taxation: collect money from the provinces of his kingdom
Assault: invade a province or attack an enemy unit
Maneuvers: reposition his units in his provinces or towards the sea
Claim: try to take control of a province by paying a cost


Assault and Claim actions can be immediately challenged by an opponent and resolved by a battle. During the battle, a bribe may be paid to the opponent to try to reverse the outcome.
Players must be vigilant in positioning their forces (with the constraint of a maximum of one unit per province), keep an eye on their opponents, and take advantage of their two asymmetrical powers: that of their kingdom and that of their king.

—description from the publisher
