boardgame.description: Cthulhu: Death May Die compatible dice designed by Customeeple
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Cthulhu: Death May Die

boardgame.name: Lost Judgment - The Kaito Files
boardgame.description:
Source: [Sega.com The Publisher Website].

Following the events of Lost Judgment, Kaito picks up a case while Yagami's out of town: An unresolved suicide with a lucrative reward. Things unexpectedly get personal with Kaito standing at the crossroads of his past and present while up against new syndicates emerging from the underbellies of Kamurocho and Ijincho.

boardgame.name: Blockazzle Craze
boardgame.description:
Blockazzle is an elastic bar which is composed of 12 cube blocks tied with an elastic rope. With special groove on each cube, Blockazzle allows kids to rotate cubes to build many different 2D & 3D structures. Kids can also use Blockazzle to challenge 3D puzzles included in this game set to practice on logic thinking, vector & space basics. Blockazzle is well designed to carry & play wherever you go. Enclosed USL cubes work as an aide to little kids or beginners.

For 2 players, they can compete against each other for building the given structure on flash cards. While for 1 player alone, one can use the two Blockazzle bars to create more puzzles with challenging fun, it is also encouraged to create more puzzles with your own thoughts.

listing.notes: Opened, unplayed.

boardgame.name: Return to Dark Tower: Card Sleeves
boardgame.description:
Give all your cards a little extra protection. This add-on includes enough high-quality sleeves to cover the cards in Return to Dark Tower and the Alliances expansion. 110 standard card sleeves and 85 mini sleeves (plus some extras for lost or broken sleeves). Most sleeves will have a custom print, but some standard-sized sleeves will be completely clear to accommodate the double-sided cards.

--Description from the Kickstarter campaign page

7×9.5×4 cm, 150 g
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Return to Dark Tower
Return to Dark Tower: Alliances

boardgame.name: Mission Control: Critical Orbit
boardgame.description:
In the year 1972, SAGA (The Space and Aeronautics Global Alliance) successfully completed the first ever hyperspace trip to Mars. But celebrations were cut short when the crew of the Mercury 3 rocket missed their reentry window and an explosion damaged the ship. Now, you must work together to bring the rocket and the crew home safely.

Mission Control: Critical Orbit is an asymmetric, cooperative, roll and write, real-time rescue adventure. One player takes on the role of the Aethernaut Flight Commander, and up to 3 players take on the roles of Flight Controllers. Each of the Controller players have unique tasks that earn tools the Aethernaut player needs to restore oxygen and critical systems to the damaged rocket. If the Aethernaut can build a path with polyominoes before the 20 minute timer runs out, you win! But if you run out time the ship suffers a catastrophic failure causing the Mercury 3 rocket to explode in orbit… and everyone loses.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Biblical Duel
boardgame.description:
The game plays out the story of Jesus Christ. Players choosing between factions the Messiah and the Evil to influence the mankind right way (by their intensions) or overpower their opponent.

Dice rolling dexterity asymmetric game where players roll dice over cards in play to get advantages over their opponent. There are two ways to win - get maximum victory points or beat the opponent by getting all 5 cards in play your side up.

Rolled dice land on cards in play and trigger cards effects or flip cards to their side depends on specific cards:

Landing on opponent’s cards – flip if land dice sum reaches at least value of the cards.
Landing on active’s player cards – it triggers specific card effect – incrementing value of another rolled die, acquiring the specific abilities, and gaining victory points. Special abilities are specific for each faction.


The game mainly consists of 9 cards:

5 both sided cards (each side belongs to specific player)
2x faction card for each faction (to track victory points and special abilities)
2x ability card for each faction (one of abilities used by placing to cards in play)


The game was made for 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Space Warlord Organ Trading Simulator
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Buy, sell and trade alien organs in sci-fi tycoon simulation.

boardgame.name: FlickFleet: Xeno Wars
boardgame.description:
This stand-alone expansion to the FlickFleet space combat dexterity game adds two new asymmetrical alien species to the game along with rules for up to 4 players (when combined with the FlickFleet base game).

The new species are: The Hive who have organic ships which can quickly heal and spit parasitic boarding pods and can grown an endless swarm of drones; and The Storm who's ships are fast and manoeuvrable, and pack a devastating punch, but are fragile and need to be protected lest they be overrun.

Flick your ships into position and then flick dice from them at your opponents' ships to damage them and degrade their systems.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameintegration: FlickFleet
FlickFleet

boardgame.name: Fantastica
boardgame.description:
Back of the Book

In the hidden land of Fantastica, fairy tales are real! Here everyone knows about magic, and that means everything is different for magical kitties. There's no need to hide your magic, and humans and kitties work together to solve their problems!

The Nine Kingdoms are ruled by princesses, princes, and fantastical creatures: Nina the Mermaid, Yuki-Onna the Snow Woman, Sinbad the Sailor, Anansi the Spider, and the lovable Puss-in-Boots. Together with other adventurers, witches, fairies, kitties, and creatures, they form the Golden Circle.

But the peace and harmony sought by the Golden Circle is threatened by terrible villains like Queen Carnelia, the rules of a land greatly harmed by magic, who now seeks to destroy all magic!

In Fantasica, our kitty krew has more to worry about than just a hometown. They have a whole kingdom!

boardgame.name: Power Up!
boardgame.description:
Back of the Book

Make your Magical Kitties series into an epic adventure that you and your player will never forget! Power Up adds epic power, epic stakes, and epic scope to your game, with new Epic Foes, Epic Problems, and rules for vast new hometowns ranging from countries to entire planets to galactic federations.

Don't worry though! Your kitty krew will be up to the task with thirty-six new Magical Powers, plus new Bonus Features, Epic Stunts, Power Quirks, and rules for advancing beyond level 10. Add exciting intrigue to your stories with Secret Origins and, if that's not enough, you can use Power Up's guidelines to create your own, all-new powers.

You'll need all the help you can get to face off against the terrifying mirror magic of the evil sorceres Soriana, the interstellar armadas of the Varlin Empire, and the invincible might of the Mecha-Raccoon.

But once you've powered up, nothing will be able to stop you and your firends from saving the day!

boardgame.name: Magical Kitties Character Sheets
boardgame.description:
Front of the Pad

Did you kitty krew use up all your character sheets ... again?

This pad of 50 full-color pre-printed character sheets for the Magical Kitties Save the Day RPG will muffle their mewling for more!

boardgame.name: Escape Comics: The Alien Ship
boardgame.description:
Earth is under threat by a mysterious Alien presence. Your mission is to get into the ship, learn their master plan and then escape in time to save the planet!

The Alien Ship is the first escape room board game incorporating an illustrated comic book to deliver the narrative. Players will encounter obstacles as they read through the book, then gain access to tactile puzzle pieces from the game box which will allow them to find a solution. The pieces mirror the situation in the book, delivering a uniquely immersive experience.

Solving each puzzle unlocks the next part of the story. "The Alien Ship" will have you yelling, "what happens next!?" every time at the end of every page.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Series Workbooks
boardgame.description:
Front of the Cover

For Gamemasters & Players

Beautiful, full-color, journal-size workbooks with everything your kitty krew needs to start recording their stories!

Record details of your hometown, your humans, your foes, and the problems you need to solve.

User Note
This is 5 books with a paper cover. One is called Our Hometown Workbook and is aimed primarily at the GM. The ohter 4 are identical and entitled My Kitty Workbook and are aimed at players.

boardgame.name: Punn Pyramid
boardgame.description:
Punn Pyramid is a game about words and their meaning. It is based on a unique relationship that exists between some words called a Word Pyramid.

The word 'Pyramid' can be used to illustrate the concept of a Word Pyramid. When P is removed from the pyramid the remaining letters are rearranged to form MYRIAD. When M is removed from myriad the remaining letters are used to form the words DAIRY and DIARY. By removing I, R and D in succession the words YARD, DAY, and AY are formed respectively. See box cover.

Players must determine words from definitions and other related clues given. Players must solve a series of unrelated words and from one to four word pyramids.

Before the game begins, Players decide how many word pyramids each player will solve and how many of them are to be solved starting with the smallest word and how many with the largest word.

When one or two word pyramids are to be solved by each player, one revolution of the perimeter must be made. When three to four word pyramids are to be solved by each player, two revolutions of the perimeter must be made.

The winner of the game is the first player who completes the required number of revolutions of the perimeter and solves the required number of word pyramids.

boardgame.name: Unleashed: A Game of Playful Pets
boardgame.description:
'Publisher Blurb'

When the humans are away, it’s time to play! In this GM-optional cooperative TTRPG, two best friends - one cat, and one dog - set out for a day of adventure.
boardgame.rpg: Unleashed: A Game of Playful Pets

boardgame.name: Crooks in Crisis
boardgame.description:
Crooks in Crisis is a comedy game all about villains struggling with modern life.

Players evolve and play as unique bad guy characters and compete to solve each others problems with a series of drawing, writing, searching and performing challenges.

To start the game each player gets a villainous profession and trait to start their character. The winner of each round earns a new trait to add to their bad guy character. The first to reach five traits wins the game.

There are millions of character combinations and thousands of challenges to play in the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Last Wyvern
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

The Last Wyvern is a Dungeon World adventure focusing on the party's journey of tracking down the last wyvern that threatens the kingdom of Skymoore. Will your party successfully track down and kill the wyvern for the 2,000-gold reward, or will the dangers of the outskirts consume you?

boardgame.name: Almanac of Lost Places
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A mountain coveted by rival kingdoms. A city where information is not a synonym of truth. The ruins of a civilisation far from being abandoned. A valley bending reality to protect itself from exploitation.

At least that's how I envisioned these maps. But there is lot of information missing, and it's up to you to fill in the blanks and pique the players' curiosity. Or maybe don't and create a sense of mystery. These four maps are meant to spark imagination and guide you towards great adventures.

There are no stats or setting associated with these maps but they would probably fit a game Troika!, UltraViolet Grasslands or Mothership.

boardgame.name: RoboCafé
boardgame.description:
In this experimental buffet, two robots compete to prove that their program is better suited to the task than the opponent's. Players are the robots programmed to find the optimal way to fulfill sequentially coming guests' orders about drinks, sandwiches and cupcakes. The game takes place on a 3 x 3 grid of cards, where players move and activate workstations with dice, preparing meals and managing their energy usage. The first robot to successfully serve 4 customers wins, and its program will be purchased from the developer and installed permanently in the cafeteria.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Razor Crest Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
Once a military patrol craft used in the time before the Empire, the Razor Crest is now the craft, and home, of the storied Mandalorian bounty hunter, Din Djarin. Now, the Mandalorian uses the Razor Crest to search the galaxy in an attempt to reunite The Child with its own kind. Perhaps the most iconic and popular starship in recent memory, the Razor Crest Expansion Pack also introduces some of the most requested characters seen in The Mandalorian to your games of Star Wars X-Wing.

X-Wing 2nd ed.: Razor Crest Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add a ST-70 Assault Ship to your Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the Razor Crest color scheme, a maneuver dial, and tokens. Additionally, four ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic assault ship into battle and fourteen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Broadsword: Of Monsters Most Foul - A Bestiary
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Broadsword is an epic fantasy adventure game that seamlessly brings together elements from classic board games with elements from tabletop roleplaying games to result in something truly extraordinary — not quite a full RPG, but much more than a simple board game.

Of Monsters Most Foul brings to the game not only a menagerie of new monsters, but also breaks off some of the existing monsters into various subtypes, truly expanding the variety of monsters to combat.

The ZIP file includes the 38-page bestiary as well as a folder full of over 50 VTT tokens, featuring the full roster of each monster from the book as well as some alternate versions for increased visual variance!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Diamond Races: Fruitables
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unleash your INNER BEAST by harnessing RAW POWER through the very photons which permeate your being, synthesizing that energy into destructive ENERGY with this Pathfinder 1st edition supplement, including just barely enough support for the popular 3rd party subsystem.

Inside this MASSIVE TOME of high quality content is 1 new race, plus class options (feats, traits, and archetypes) and 2 stat blocks.

Also this book is about fruit and vegetables.

boardgame.name: A Comforting Apocolypse
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Comforting Apocalypse is a story roleplaying game about people gathering during the last days of the world, as nomadic scavenging and community rebuilding looms on the horizon. Characters are people who ‘always knew this day would come,’ and now look forward to a future without the noise of the (previously) modern society. But as the reality of their lives close in, they must deal with certain uncomfortable facts of the new age of humanity.

This game introduces a number of new rules and order of operations to the Protocol system, creating a new way in which to use this system. Expect more games in the series to be updated in this fashion.

Protocol is a series of story roleplaying games that thrusts characters together into dramatic situations. Each game uses the same set of rules, with vastly different parameters, start points, characters, and finales. Players take on the roles of directors outside the action and characters inside the action, using the ebb and flow of four different scene-framing styles (vignettes, interrogations, interludes, and ensembles) to tell meaningful stories about characters in crisis.

Each game in the Protocol series is zero-prep for 3 or more players. The game length is exponentially long, so games with more players take more time to complete. The Protocol Series requires a deck of poker cards as well as tokens to track drama points.

boardgame.name: L'écho éthérique Nº 19
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

L'écho éthérique est un supplément périodique pour Lore & Legacy, le jeu de rôle de science-fantasy. Tous les mois, nous vous proposerons en prix libre 12 pages de contenu supplémentaire pour le jeu.

Ce numéro contient la première partie d'On ne fait pas d'automate sans casser des œufs, une grande aventure se déroulant à Brasto et sa région, mettant en scène les lieux et personnages décrits dans les précédents Échos Éthériques.

boardgame.name: Hazard: Wildfire!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A bracing hike through the woods is followed by setting up and relaxing in a campsite outdoors amidst nature. One of the party remarks on the gorgeous sunset…a sunset that supposedly happened an hour before. Another of the party then swears they smell smoke, while another claims the air seems to have gotten warmer. In a moment, they realize what is coming upon them and hurry to strike their campsite and escape just as a line of bright, flickering lights appears on the hills…

A wildfire is a catchall term for any uncontrolled fire occurring in a wilderness area. While the term is most often applied to a forest fire, wildfires also occur in other types of terrain, and are identified accordingly: prairie, brush, bush, desert, grass, hill, peat, vegetation, or veldfire.

Hazard: Wildfire! gives the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game Referees the tools to impose this friend of humanity turned implacable, deadly foe on hir game. While short, the file is packed with information on the types of wildfires, their causes, their effects on the game and stats for running a wildfire during an adventure.

Hazard: Wildfire! Playing with fire will get you burned…or worse.

boardgame.name: Kallista's Floating Keep
boardgame.description:
An entry in the Tenfootpole Wavestone Deep contest!

From the publishers blurb:

“Fear the mists, fear the tides, fear the seagull’s call! A sea witch from a bygone age has returned to exact revenge, her floating keep spelling doom for surface dwellers!”

boardgame.name: Pardon the Interruption
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One of the more significant occasions for a Dracian community is the celebration of a ‘bonding’. People come together and share their lives for the briefest of moments, supporting the importance of the knot binding ceremony between two people and their families. For a young couple of Gsteln Vol-Den, just outside the city of Iinor-Den, the celebration was a day away and all seemed ready. But during the Gathering of Shields, a commotion of dazzling lights and rampant rabbits allowed someone or something to covertly swipe the ceremonial gifts.

Pardon the Interruption is a Q-Encounter, or Quick-Encounter, that can be run for a group of four to six players with 2nd-level characters or higher. This encounter would be considered a ‘medium’ to ‘hard’ encounter.

boardgame.name: Factor
boardgame.description:
The family-game of multiplication.

Steal your friend's factors, combine factors to new products, use the unknown x-factor well to win the game. And get better at math in the meantime.

Included: The Fctor challenge for solitary play. Who can solve the Factor puzzle?

A fun and quick card fame for the whole family. The game improves your understanding of numbers and multiplication, while you collect tricks, and steal the best cards from your opponents.

boardgame.name: Derelict Cruisers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two dark ultra-short sci-fi derelict space-ship adventure-seeds.
“Advantage II”
People have been flocking through the desert for weeks, since the huge derelict space-ship
was pulled closer to the planet’s surface. Somehow, the ship managed to avoid a collision – and
stopped, hovering just about one kilometer up in the atmosphere.

“What about the gift shop?”
On a patrol in a desolated part of space, the adventurers approach a large, partly destroyed, ship. It is the “USS Cretaceous” - with large window, not completely broken, with a huge sign inside: “Gift shop”.

This is a small booklet (9 paged PDF-file) with two small sci-fi adventure seeds. The GameMaster needs to flesh out NPC:s, add proper values (depending on what rule system you use) and perhaps create maps etc.

The adventures are fast/short and linear - but with heavy insta-death-possible endings.

Both adventures use derelict space ships as a backdrop.

You should be able to use this with "any" science-fiction/space Roleplaying Rule System.

boardgame.name: Tennidice
boardgame.description:
Who is the luckiest tennis player in the world?
Tennidice is a 2-or-4-player game that simulates an actual tennis match. Instead of using rackets, you need some dice, and also, you use the strategy cubes to strengthen your abilities to win, but sometimes lucky opponents don’t allow you to succeed!

You can play Tennidice in two different modes:
1. Tie-breaker mode (15minutes)
•This mode simulates a real tennis tie-breaker. The first one who gets the 7th point wins the match.
2. A 2-set-match game (60minutes)
•This mode simulates the whole tennis match of two sets. The player who succeeds in two sets of three wins the match.

Each round of Tennidice starts with serve and continues in
rally until a player wins a point.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cold Iron
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cold Iron is a module that takes place in the fantasy world of Drakuva, a creation of Tabletop Totality. The module itself is designed for the beginning lower tier of gameplay, levels 1 through 5 using the world most popular TTRPG system.

Players will start either in the small settlement of Port Kasun or upon recently arriving to an area nearby. Port Kasun is near the southern end of the massive Lake Orrin and is nestled on the Cinder’s River, leading back out to the sea through Steam-Eater Bay, making it an active and popular hub of travelers, traders and more. Port Kasun has a known reputation as an active den of adventurers, explorers, mercenaries, pirates and thieves. These various special interests and their factions fall under the iron rule of The Black Code, a criminal organization that keeps Port Kasun open for business and the nobility paid enough to look the other way. There are many who claim that the nobility, specifically the ruling Princess Djamilla, are just as much a part of The Black Code as the lowliest cut purse in the settlement.

The Party comes into the story as they learn that a local Dwarf named Urrkus has been, as of yet, unable to find any group willing to take on a specific job. Urrkus is what is known as a Broker for The Black Code, handling the arrangement of specific jobs, connecting those who are looking with those that can pay. The job he has is the retrieval of an ancient Helm from the ruin of Calabaz Tower. According to Urrkus, the buyer is willing to pay a hefty price and has deep pockets.

Calabaz Tower was once the seat of power of a religious order with powerful divination magic. The death of their last prophetess, the Haruspex Erderna, would send this once mighty order to ruin at the hands of one of their own. In what was formerly the settlement of Vatysyn, Calabaz Tower hangs in the sky, broken and yet still defying gravity while the land all around it cursed with aftermath of a terrible tragedy.

boardgame.name: Final Exam
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A solitaire adventure for use with Tunnels & Trolls (including Deluxe), Monsters! Monsters! and similar works.

You’re a wizard, albeit a young one. For years, you studied hard in Cormac’s School of Wizardry, an officially recognized branch of the Wizards’ Guild.

Cormac’s school has quite the reputation, having trained some of the greatest wizards of the modern era, like Branikar Firaxus, Arianna Nemeth, and Madra Markoulides, just to name a few. What sets the initiates who graduate from Cormac’s school from the others? The Final Exam.

It’s more than just a test of your arcane skills; it’s a test of character. Are you ready to face the world of adventuring? If you pass Final Exam, there’s no question.

boardgame.name: Marvel Dice Throne: Black Widow v. Doctor Strange
boardgame.description:
In Marvel Dice Throne , you become one of eight of Marvel's most famous heroes, including Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Black Widow, Scarlet Witch, Loki, Thor, Doctor Strange, and Miles Morales Spider-man! Every Marvel Dice Throne hero was painstakingly designed and balanced to provide the most thematic experience possible, allowing you to truly embody your favorite heroes like no other game. Featuring all-new mechanisms and asymmetrical designs, these are our most innovative and exciting heroes yet.

Marvel Dice Throne is a heart-pumping, fast-playing game of skilled card play and dice manipulation supporting multiple modes of play, including 1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all.

Attack your opponents and activate abilities by rolling your hero's unique set of five dice. Accumulate combat points and spend them on cards that have a large range of effects, such as granting permanent hero upgrades, applying status effects, and manipulating dice directly (yours, your teammate's, or even your opponent's).

All 8 heroes are compatible with the entire Dice Throne ecosystem
Use upgrade cards to improve your hero abilities as the game progresses
Play action cards strategically to manipulate dice and surprise your foe
Features a deluxe, highly functional, Battle Chest storage system
Each hero in the Battle Chest has their own beautiful set of custom swirl dice

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – 2020 Open Play Kit – Season 1
boardgame.description: Open play promos for Marvel Champions. Extended art promo cards. Three double-sided heroes, three events.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Champions: The Card Game
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Black Widow Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Ms. Marvel Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Thor Hero Pack

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – 2020 First Story Kit
boardgame.description: Alternate art villains and playmats.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Champions: The Card Game
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Green Goblin Scenario Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Wrecking Crew Scenario Pack

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – 2021 Open Play Kit: Season 2
boardgame.description: Alternate art cards for three Heroes, and three event cards
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Champions: The Card Game
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Captain America Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Doctor Strange Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Hulk Hero Pack

boardgame.name: The Best Friend Game
boardgame.description:
Put your friendship to the test! The Best Friend Game is like the Newlywed Game – but for friends. Do you know your best friend's celebrity crush? What about their favorite swear word or go-to Starbucks order? Pair off and play with your best friend, boyfriend, girlfriend, mom, dad, sister, brother or dog!

How to Play:
Pair off in teams of two, making sure the teams include pairs that know each other pretty well. Pull a question card and write down your answers in secret on the dry erase boards. Reveal your answers and matching answers get a point. First pair to 7 points wins the game.

boardgame.name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Fall 2021 Promos
boardgame.description: Alternate art promos for three Heroes and 1 Villain. And a new alternate health tracker
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Marvel Champions: The Card Game
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Nebula Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Mad Titan's Shadow
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – Valkyrie Hero Pack
Marvel Champions: The Card Game – War Machine Hero Pack

boardgame.name: Nero: Freight Hauler
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed for the Near-Earth Recovery Operations consortium to help rebuild the homeworld, the Nero-class
freight hauler is a massive, form-follows-function, brick of a ship. At 800 feet stem to stern, it features eight
cargo holds, each six stories high, and can carry up to 280 crew and passengers. This ship can haul 30,000
register tons of cargo neatly stored in the latest Z.E.T.A. cargo containers, and a lot more in loose or liquid cargo.

The Nero deckplans are built from large, reusable, modules that will be expanded upon in future capital ship
and station projects. Because a couple of cargo hold sections are used to represent multiple levels and multiple
holds, extra pages with crates and containers are provided to cut out and arrange within the holds as desired.
As a bonus, the holds can be used as a stand-alone storage facility. Overview maps and renderings for this
option are included.

The Nero package contains several highly detailed, layered PDF files:

• Main Book
- 26 page PDF file detailing the interior areas of the ship.
- Contains rendered scenes as well as orthographic views.
- Includes system-independent statistics designed for easy adaptation to your game of choice.
- Background, art, and text are on different layers for custom display and printing.
• Map Pages
- 77 page PDF file containing complete interior maps and instructions for assembly.
- Miniature-scale maps for tactical combat with an optional 1 inch = 5 ft grid.
- Divided into pages for easy printing in full color or printer-friendly black and white.
- Selectable layers include: grid, black & white version, and optional cargo.
- Also two pages of crates and cargo containers to cut out and put into the holds.
• Uncut Map Images
- Four PDF files containing 24x36” images of the deckplan sections.
- Select either a light or dark background (for printing or projection/display).
- Includes layers for grid, black & white version, optional cargo, and background choice.
- Flat jpeg images, grid-aligned, on a dark background are also provided for use on screen.

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Pseudotech – Arcade Operations
boardgame.description:
So, you call yourself an “Elite MechWarrior,” huh? What’s your top score in Grand ’Mech Melee, huh? Your longest chain in Tankertris? Have you ever beaten the Stinger Challenge? Where’s your Legendary Duelist medal? Bet you can’t even complete a single wave of Droneroids on your first life without a Shield buff! Go back to your Maraudero Party games, you noob!

Just because there’s a war on and you’re driving fifty-five tons of high-tech armor and weaponry in a giant, walking avatar of death doesn’t mean you can’t have a little fun, does it? Of course not! PseudoTech: Arcade Operations presents ways to spice up your BattleTech games in a manner that will amuse even the grimmest and most jaded of veterans. From power-ups that can offer your ride anything from instant death to temporary invincibility, to medal-worthy challenges beyond the humdrum monotony of win-or-die missions, show the Inner Sphere what you’ve got in nearly a dozen new scenario types—all presented in bright, colorful, holographic splendor, right on your very own tabletops! Special rules provide the classic arcade flavor your battles have been missing ever since you left the academy for the front lines, with bold new battle ribbons to be earned as you build a new kind of legendary status as king of your local military entertainment center!

Oh, and be sure to load up on extra tokens. The competition looks pretty fierce out there!

—description from the publisher

April Fool's 2022 release
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Blue Steel Brewery
boardgame.description: Blue Steel Brewery is a "roll and write" game that puts the player in the seat of a manager, at a beer-making company. The goal is to take the initial capital and increase the size of the business by buying ingredients from the fluctuating market and producing various types of beers and ales to sell. Logistically, ales are a type of beer, but for the sake of the function of the game, they are separate. The market prices are determined by dice rolls, which is the only use of dice. You, the player, then choose which ingredients to buy knowing which beer/ale to produce and the sale price of that beer or ale. There is also the company building, which graphically represents the "company building." The player then uses the in-game coins to buy extra beer/ale producers and storage. Additionally, the storage aspect of the game allows beers/ales to gain monetary benefits by letting them ferment. The bulk of the end-game points tends to focus on the company building, so be wary. The company building is the layout of the objects you buy; a visual representation.

boardgame.name: 10 Shark-themed Magical Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jump in the deep end of the ocean with the Sharktastic product line!

In 10 Shark-themed Magical Items, the great Navid Salechii the Wanderer tells the fascinating stories of items they have encountered through their travels, all related somehow to that most noble of all aquatic beasts, the shark.

Whether it is a fashionable Denticle Cloak, a fearsome Tiburon Helmet, or a wondrous Black Pearl Ioun Stone, there is surely something for everyone in this fantastic collection.

Don't delay, become SHARKTASTIC today!

boardgame.name: 10 Shark-themed Unusual Items
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jump in the deep end of the ocean with the Sharktastic product line!

In 10 Shark-themed Unusual Items, the great Navid Salechii the Wanderer tells the fascinating stories of items they have encountered through their travels, all related somehow to that most noble of all aquatic beasts, the shark.

Whether it is an imposing Great White Shark Figurehead, an ingenious Clockwork Shark, or a useful bag of Shark Tooth Caltrops, there is surely something for everyone in this fantastic collection.

Don't delay, become SHARKTASTIC today!

boardgame.name: Castle Shadowspire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore adventurous locations across the multiverse with the Geographica line!

Bridging the gap between the primal forces of Life and Death, Castle Shadowspire stands wreathed in ever-growing shadows that threaten to spill over and consume all.

Will you stand with the verdant forces of the weald guardians to keep the shadow blight at bay, or will you listen to the enticing words of the Voice in Shadows and bring a new darkness into the world? The choice is yours.

Castle Shadowspire features a tour and lore of the castle lands, as well as new games rules including Land Magic and The Voice in Shadows, a new Warlock patron.

Pack your gear and travel the lands of the River Sideralis with Geographica!

boardgame.name: Streets of Fury EX
boardgame.description:
Fight the gangs of Paris in this action packed Beat'Em up. Up to 4 players can join in, to cooperate, or fight against each other! Many unlockables, game modes, crazy combos and devastating furies await you in this deep fighting game.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Sötétség Szolgái
Služebníci Temnoty
Služobníci temnoty
boardgame.description:
Hide in the skin of the wicked and start the exciting game! Each player embodies an evil in this colorful game, and their goal is to get treasures from the city and return to the Land of Darkness. You have to be skillful as the Superheroes will try to stop everyone in their mission and no one may even return to the Land of Darkness!

You must place the tiles in a field. After that you will roll whit the dice. If the the villian land on a same colored hero than his background, then lose 1 hp. 3 hit and out of the round! Nothing happens, if not the same color as the background. Thera are mistery tiles, that can be go back two place, move 1 back or front, or changge two different tiles! The winner is who get the treasure back the beggining or the last one standing player wins!

boardgame.name: The Biggest CHONK Card Game
boardgame.description:
The cards list CHONK information and the aim of the game is to compare these values to try to trump and win an opponent's card.

Each pack includes 36 playing cards, instructions, 3 blank cards you can customize yourself and a helpful CHONK chart.

Rules:

2 or more players can play
Player to the left of the dealer chooses their best stat they want to compare
The highest stat (number) wins and the player takes both cards
Winner of the previous round gets to choose the next stat
If both stats are the same, the players tap their cards (meaning they turn them sideways), then they each add an additional card turned upside down on top, and finally they play the stat game again with a third card. The winning player takes all six cards
Instead of playing a stat, players can also guess the cat's favourite food (chicken, fish, beef, pork, lard or treats). If they guess correctly, they win both cards
The game ends when all cards are drawn, and the player with the most cards wins

boardgame.name: Oster-Rubbel-Kalender
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. If a player gets on a space with a shrub he gets to scrub the shrub away to reveal a picture of what is hiding behind to hinder or benefit the player. Obviously the scrubbing part works only for the first time playing the game. The first player to reach shrub 12 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the magazine "Journal für die Frau" No. 7/1991.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Honey Buzz: Large Orders Dice Tower Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Available as part of the 2020 Dice Tower Kickstarter D Pack.

To complete this Large Order, return to the supply three different honey types during your turn. This card is worth 6 points.

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Rokke Class Research Vessel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Rokke Class Research Vessel is intended for planetary observation and research, and is specifically optimised for marine exploration. The 600dton vessel is capable of Jump-2, sustained 2-G Manoeuvre and extended duration. It comes fitted with a marine exploration launch and a moon pool, as well as two air-rafts and a Standard Class Runabout.

This guide contains:

Ship art. Ship statistics and description.
Crew Manifest.
Design Specifications.
Standard Class Runabout statistics and description.
Fisk Class Mini Submarine statistics and description.
13 pages of deck plans (empty and cluttered).
A choice of 8 pre-generated character cards for player crew.
Roll D20 Assets

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 40)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 40 of Gallant Knight Games' house e-zine is here! Featuring the following columns:

Steffie de Vaan presents Neverwhere, a setting and city for Tiny Dungeon 2e.
Beasts Beyond Bounds, an ongoing creature feature by Colin Chapman continues apace.
John Kennedy contribuets an article about using Kaiju in your TinyD6 games!
A new heritage: the Duckin, from Alan Bahr for any TinyD6 game.

boardgame.name: Urban Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Are you a busy GM? Does session prep take too long? Do you never have time to work on the cool little details that can bring your session to life? Well fear not! That’s where the 20 Things line comes in. This short, focused compilation gives you, the time-crunched GM, the tools to effortlessly add verisimilitude and detail to your adventure. Use the material herein either before or during play and bask in your players' adulation.

This instalment is designed to help you to flesh out and bring to life the urban events in your campaign.

boardgame.name: Venn
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Venn is to get your teammates to guess a secret code first. Twelve word cards will be laid out at random, and the code that the cluegivers see has three numbers on it from 1-12.

Three large plastic circular overlays in yellow, blue, and pink are laid out on the table, with the circles overlapping to create a large Venn diagram. Each cluegiver has a hand of cards showing absurdist imagery, and they'll take turns placing cards into various sections of the Venn diagram to try to give clues to their teammates about the words indicated by the code.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: The Glassblower Guild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first adventure in a group of five called The Bead Road. The team arrives at a large city and gets caught up in a fight between the glassblower guild and a guardian of a child the guild claims. Will they help the guardian and the child?

They also learn about the caravan soon leaving on a long journey to a faraway land.

There are twelve NPCs with distinct voices and characters. Up to four of them will continue to the next adventure in line.

There are two possible fights.

Human characters.

boardgame.name: Future Me Problems
boardgame.description:
Future Me Problems taps into all the responsibilities we would rather put off but in a way only lazy lumps like us can truly appreciate. It's a card game that not only celebrates procrastination — it rewards you for it!

In Future Me Problems, the goal of the game is to earn as many points as you can by collecting valuable distraction cards from the activity deck and avoiding penalty-giving responsibility cards. Players accomplish this by planning out their turns using schedule cards. Schedule cards let you do things like draw cards from the activity deck, flip the activity deck over, and even force other players to draw cards from the activity deck.

At the start of the game, the dreaded Large, Important Task card is placed in the center of the activity deck. Whoever is forced to draw that card will receive a big penalty and end the game! When that happens, everyone adds up their points and the player with the most points from collected activity cards wins the game.

Future Me Problems is based on the popular web comic Sarah’s Scribbles, by Sarah Andersen.

boardgame.name: The Valley of the Thousand Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team makes it across the mountains with the caravan and arrives in dry desert valley with mysterious stone statues. There are about a thousand of them. They only have a few days to find their secret, before the caravan moves on.

boardgame.name: The Ancient Door
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team and the caravan they travel with reaches Kijiji village where they will pay a captain to take them across the lake of Ziwa.

But across the vast lake, three figurines have been stolen and they are not welcome unless they bring back the stolen items, which they claim are in Kijiji.

Once they are found the team set sails across when someone insists they should visit the Drowned Temple. Once there, the figurines turn out to have powers.

boardgame.name: The Telltale Forest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team and the caravan they travel with has reached Isigodi Village but the road through Ichibi forest has become dangerous. The spirits are away and will lead you astray. Shall you wait with the caravan or should you leave and take your chances with the forest?

boardgame.name: The Wishing Tree
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a generic adventure in a fantasy environment with a bit of magic.

The party finds a huge tree in the forest, told to grant wishes. They could either be physical or psychical. Some things have to be done to a cost to get a wish, and finding the right ingredients is not easy. This is very much an adventure where the team needs to search for information to get it right. Killing the wrong people and you will never get the ingredients.

This is a perfect adventure to add to a longer campaign where the party needs an option to get money or rearrange their stats. It can also be a place possible to return to. The players do not get what they desire just because they get the ingredients, though. If they want something physical, they get a crystal apple from the tree. The further away from the tree, they try to sell it - in another adventure probably - the more money they will get.

There are several interesting NPCs with example dialog.

This adventure is based on the idea of exploring and talking, not fighting. However, there are options to add enemies to fight if the Game Master wants to.

boardgame.name: The Ink Maker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure where there is a kidnapped young prince trapped by a spell. There are two ways to break the spell. One is to get the ink maker to create the right ink if the team finds the ingredients. Another is to get the wizard who cast the spell to make it undone.

There are eleven NPCs with distinct voices and characters.

There is one possible fight.

Human characters.

Magic is used.

boardgame.name: The War of the Seven Bridges
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The team walks right into a conflict between three villages that has going on for generations. It is possible that the team might put an end to this. Even if they find that task too overwhelming there are rumors about a hidden treasure.

This is a system-agnostic adventure focused on the story and its characters.

All my adventures are system agnostic, set in a low-magic fantasy environment, mostly populated by humans. They are focused on the story and the characters, demanding interaction by talking rather than fighting to solve the puzzle.

They can be used stand-alone as well as added as a part of a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: In Mining Kingdom
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The people of Nalar are worried because they think the Dwarfs in the halls below their town seek to destroy them. The Dwarfs on the other hand just want to set a treaty with them. But will they get their voice heard?

This is a system-agnostic adventure focused on the story and its characters. It has multiple possible endings and the team can walk away rich or proud or both.
All my adventures are system agnostic, set in a low-magic fantasy environment, mostly populated by humans. They are focused on the story and the characters, demanding interaction by talking rather than fighting to solve the puzzle.

They can be used stand-alone as well as added as a part of a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: The Pit of Fire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a generic adventure (= not tied to a specific set of rules) in a fantasy environment with a bit of magic.

The party arrives at a village that seems deserted. But at a given time the villagers appear. Not only are they hostile, but there is also something dead about them. Like they are living dead.

The source of this evil deed is found in a castle in the mountains where a lord has been playing with magic and potions.

To fight the lord the team has to find their way through the castle's labyrinth to the top of the tower above the lava pit.

boardgame.name: The Singing Ice (System Neutral)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party enters a castle that at first seems to be abandoned. But something is not right. It is empty and cold but clean and cared for.

The princess has been turned into a beast. The spell will not be broken until a special crystal is placed in the highest tower. If that is done, it is proof that the princess learned to ask for help.

The crystal is found on the other side of a portal, guarded by a dragon that should not be awoken.

But it not just to walk up to the portal and get in. Where is it and how does it work? And will the team notice that they are about wake a dragon before it is too late?

As in most of my adventures the focus is around the story and its characters, not the fighting. If fighting is of interest, it is possible to add enemies.

boardgame.name: Prince Easjeff of Coriell
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The story starts a rainy day at an inn where one from a royal party bursts inside asking for Prince Easjeff. They have been attacked and the prince is missing.

The setting is fantasy, low-magic, and with more detective skills than fighting.

This is the second edition of an adventure written for a Kickstarter. It has an updated map and cover compared to that version.

All my adventures are system agnostic, set in a low-magic fantasy environment, mostly populated by humans. They are focused on the story and the characters, demanding interaction by talking rather than fighting to solve the puzzle.

They can be used stand-alone as well as added as a part of a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: The Beach Palace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is a locked castle and a hidden key. A gang of pirates knows where to start looking, but is it a good idea to corporate with them?

There is a magic item and magic potions in this adventure. There are also puzzles to be solved. It takes place over a small area and for the characters, it is a matter of a day, maybe two.

This is a system-agnostic adventure focused on the story and its characters.

All my adventures are system agnostic, set in a low-magic fantasy environment, mostly populated by humans. They are focused on the story and the characters, demanding interaction by talking rather than fighting to solve the puzzle.

They can be used stand-alone as well as added as a part of a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: By the Voice of a Wizard
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a generic adventure (= not tied to a specific set of rules) in a fantasy environment with magic and a dragon.

The party arrives at a valley of wealthy farmlands when a dragon appears and steals a sheep from the nearest farm. A closer inspection tells that it was the last cattle in the area and the villagers fear the dragon will go for the kids next. Research point in the direction of the 'local wizard' who is told to have the dragon as her pet.

But the wizard is not that eager to help and the dragon is the result of one of her spells going wrong.

There are several interesting NPCs with example dialog. All the NPCs have a face.

This adventure is based on the idea of exploring, talking, and problem-solving, not fighting.

boardgame.name: The Stolen Goblet
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a system-agnostic adventure focused on the story and its characters. It has five possible endings and the team can walk away rich, punished, or imprisoned. It can be placed in a larger campaign.

The team walks right into a setup where they are accused of stealing the Royal Family's golden goblet. In this adventure they will leave on a quest without weapons or equipment, to find out who stole the goblet and prove their innocence. In just a day.

boardgame.name: The Tower of Torture
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Well, that can explain why you ended up in these parts. Not many others have reason to come here any longer, you see.”

“Why is that?” you ask.

“’ Cause of the curse, you see. The Tower, the Tower of Torture. It continues to torture us long after it’s out of use. I suppose it is all those souls, you see, not put to rest.”

The setting is fantasy, low-magic, and with a mental fight against the demon in the tower.

This is the third edition of an adventure written for a Kickstarter. It has an updated map and cover compared to that version.

All my adventures are system agnostic, set in a low-magic fantasy environment, mostly populated by humans. They are focused on the story and the characters, demanding interaction by talking rather than fighting to solve the puzzle.

They can be used stand-alone as well as added as a part of a larger campaign.

boardgame.name: Six Random Meetings
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a description of six NPCs, three men, and three women. They could be people to meet at an inn or by the road or in a village your team passes. Each character got a portrait and a description of the character's situation, lifestyle, and desires.

They could be used as keeper of vital information, or as people to be used for their skill. Or just an interesting character to add flavour and/or confusion.

boardgame.name: Dust Bunnies and Deities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A middling enchanter and magic item crafter has been experimenting with power far beyond his own - which always spells trouble - but even moreso when he accidentally shrinks the eldritch entity and loses it! Time to get down and dirty and give this creature a fight with someone its own size!

Dust Bunnies and Deities is a Fifth Edition adventure designed for four to six characters of 11th to 15th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 13.

This adventure contains 3 new monsters, 2 custom battlemaps, 3 new magic items and 2 musical tracks to bring your session to life!

boardgame.name: Near and Far: Insert Here Organizer
boardgame.description: This storage system will hold the base game and the Amber Mines expansion.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Near and Far
Near and Far: Amber Mines

boardgame.name: Infernax
boardgame.description:
Using a revolutionary, or at least it was back in 1988, leveling system, Infernax is an old school adventure platformer game with puzzle elements. It's a whole new innovative style and since nobody has ever done anything of the like, we'll name it ourselves, ARPG, which stands for Awesomely Radical Playing... Game, patent pending.

All kidding aside, we tried to capture the essence of the games that left a mark on our childhoods, the ones who lit up the spark that made us want to make games of our own.

This is a recreation of that experience we had growing up playing obscure NES games, the kind of game that left you with a feeling of accomplishment once you beat it, several months after the initial purchase.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Degenerates: Hand of Doom – Pickle Imp
boardgame.description:
Exclusive monster card to be used with Dungeon Degenerates Hand of Doom.

Name: Pickle Imp
Class: Weird
Val: 2xp / 3 gold
Target: Lowest MRL
Attack: 2
Armor: 0
HP: 3
Abilities: Annoy / Evade

boardgame.name: Dom Pierre: Playmat
boardgame.description: A game mat of the board that was unlocked as an add-on for backers during the Kickstart campaign. It was available through the R&R Games backerkit and may be available through the publisher in the future.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Dom Pierre

boardgame.name: Magic: The Gathering – Zendikar Rising
Magic: The Gathering — Zendikar Rising Commander: Land's Wrath
Magic: The Gathering — Zendikar Rising Commander: Sneak Attack
boardgame.description:
This expansion for Magic: The Gathering returns to the world of Zendikar after the defeat of the Eldrazi menace in Oath of the Gatewatch. The skyclaves, floating ruins from an ancient Kor civilization, have risen into the air once more after being buried for millennia. Priceless artifacts lie within, and adventurers are already mounting treasure-hunting expeditions. Among the treasure hunters is the Kor planeswalker Nahiri, who has a plan to bring Zendikar back to its old glory days...at any cost.

Zendikar Rising sees the return of player favorite mechanics Kicker and Landfall, and introduces Party, a new twist on allies. Also featured in the set are special modal double-faced cards that can be played either as lands or spells.

The set contains 280 cards (101 commons, 80 uncommons, 64 rares, 20 mythic rares, and 15 full-art basic lands).
